name: Console Cube
description: Provides standard metrics and dimensions at a one-minute granularity.

dimensions.name: Continent
dimensions.description: Viewer location. Available granularities are continent, region, country, and city.

dimensions.name: Country
dimensions.description: Country from which viewer requested media.

dimensions.name: Future Use #1
dimensions.description: reserved_L3_1

dimensions.name: Region
dimensions.description: Region from which viewer requested media.

dimensions.name: Future Use #2
dimensions.description: reserved_L3_2

dimensions.name: Connection Speed
dimensions.description: Internet connection speed of the visitor. Represented as low, mid, high, and very high.

dimensions.name: Future Use #3
dimensions.description: reserved_L3_3

dimensions.name: Format
dimensions.description: Set automatically to the encode and delivery format of the media. For example, WMS, Flash, Real, or Progressive Downloads.

dimensions.name: Future Use #4
dimensions.description: reserved_L3_4

dimensions.name: Future Use #5
dimensions.description: reserved_L3_5

dimensions.name: Time
dimensions.description: Time as per time zone specified in the report.

dimensions.name: Error Code
dimensions.description: Code representing the encountered error.

dimensions.name: Service Provider
dimensions.description: CDN or delivery service provider used to stream the content.

dimensions.name: Stream Name
dimensions.description: Set automatically. Indicates the stream URL.

dimensions.name: Category
dimensions.description: Category of the content. For example: channel name, genre, or content type (movies, tv shows, sports events, or other events).

dimensions.name: Player ID
dimensions.description: Name and version of player that played the media.

dimensions.name: Title/Event Name
dimensions.description: Name of the title/event.

dimensions.name: Start Up Time Range
dimensions.description: The range of the sum of 'Connect Time' and 'Initial Buffer Time' experienced during a visit.

dimensions.name: City
dimensions.description: City from which viewer requested media.

dimensions.name: AS Name
dimensions.description: Name associated with the autonomous system of the internet service provider.

dimensions.name: Device
dimensions.description: Device that played the media.

dimensions.name: Live VoD 24x7
dimensions.description: Indicates live, on-demand, or 24x7 content.

dimensions.name: Device Type
dimensions.description: Type of device that played the media. For example, mobile phone, tablet, or desktop.

dimensions.name: OS
dimensions.description: Operating system of the device that played the media.

dimensions.name: Browser
dimensions.description: Browser that played the media.

metrics.name: Errors
metrics.description: Total count of all errors

metrics.name: Availability
metrics.description: Average availability of media during user attempts to access it (excludes user abandons).

metrics.name: Rebuffer Time per Play
metrics.description: Average time spent on rebuffering during each play.

metrics.name: Bandwidth
metrics.description: Average bandwidth experienced by users viewing streams. Player buffer fills are sampled at regular intervals of 500 milliseconds at this bit rate. Average bandwith (bps) is the sum average of all such samples.

metrics.name: Frames per Second
metrics.description: Average number of frames rendered per second per session during playback. The frames per second values are sampled at regular intervals during playback (~500ms)

metrics.name: Rebuffer Abandons
metrics.description: Sum of plays abandoned during a rebuffering event

metrics.name: Start Up Time
metrics.description: Average startup time per session

metrics.name: % Mid Play Errors
metrics.description: Percentage of errors experienced during the middle of play after successful play start.

metrics.name: Rebuffers per Play
metrics.description: Average number of rebuffers experienced per play

metrics.name: Upshifts
metrics.description: Average number of times users experienced a bitrate upshift per session

metrics.name: Downshifts
metrics.description: Average number of times users experienced a bitrate downshift per session

metrics.name: Plays with Rebuffers
metrics.description: Sum of Plays with at least one rebuffering event

metrics.name: First Rebuffers
metrics.description: First Rebuffers

metrics.name: Plays Started
metrics.description: Attempts to playback content that result in successful playback.

metrics.name: Bitrate
metrics.description: Average bitrate at which stream played back (kbps). Samples are calculated at regular time intervals during playback (~500ms)

metrics.name: % Rebuffering Plays
metrics.description: Weighted average of the proportion of rebuffering sessions calculated at 1 minute, expressed as a percentage. You can plot this metric with content, ad, and geo dimensions to understand when rebuffering occurs most and the size of audience it affects

metrics.name: Dropped Frames
metrics.description: Average number of frames dropped per session during playback

metrics.name: Start Up Errors
metrics.description: Number of startup errors

metrics.name: Connect Time
metrics.description: Average time spent over initial connection to the server per session (secs)

metrics.name: Buffer Time
metrics.description: Average time spent over initial buffering before the play starts per session (secs)

metrics.name: Audience Size
metrics.description: Sum of concurrent streams or plays at a particular point in time. Not an aggregated value like Attempts or Plays. When used in any chart other than time chart, Audience Size shows the value at the end of chosen duration

metrics.name: Attempts
metrics.description: Total number of attempts made to play streams.

metrics.name: % Rebuffering Plays(Avg)
metrics.description: Percentage of sessions that experienced rebuffers; calculated as the ratio of number of sessions rebuffering at least once to the total number of active sessions expressed as a percentage

metrics.name: Rebuffer Time per Minute
metrics.description: Average amount of time spent rebuffering per minute of playback.

metrics.name: HD Play Duration
metrics.description: The time over which the stream played in HD quality (>=2.5 mpbs, in hours)

metrics.name: HQ Play Duration
metrics.description: The time over which the stream played in HQ quality (>=1.5 mpbs and <2.5mbps, in hours)

metrics.name: SD Play Duration
metrics.description: The time over which the stream played in SD quality (<1.5 mpbs, in hours)

metrics.name: Aggregate Play Duration
metrics.description: Total number of hours that users played streams.

metrics.name: Play Duration per Play
metrics.description: Play Duration divided by (Sum of) Plays.

metrics.name: Plays Ended
metrics.description: Plays ended include both completed and abandoned plays. Plot this metric with dimensions such as `Rebuffer time per Minute`, `Rebuffers per Minute`, etc.

name: Notification Cube
description: Provides metrics and dimensions for use in obtaining details on triggered notifications.

dimensions.name: Start Up Time Range
dimensions.description: The range of the sum of 'Connect Time' and 'Initial Buffer Time' experienced during a visit.

dimensions.name: Title
dimensions.description: Name of the title/event.

dimensions.name: City
dimensions.description: City from which viewer requested media.

dimensions.name: AS Name
dimensions.description: Name associated with the ASN of the ISP.

dimensions.name: Continent
dimensions.description: Viewer location. Available granularities are Continent, Region, Country & City

dimensions.name: Country
dimensions.description: Country from which viewer requested media

dimensions.name: Region
dimensions.description: Region from which viewer requested media

dimensions.name: City
dimensions.description: City from which viewer requested media

dimensions.name: Connection Speed
dimensions.description: Internet connection speed of the visitor. Represented as Low, Mid, High & Very High.

dimensions.name: Format
dimensions.description: Set automatically to the encode and delivery format of the media. For example, WMS, Flash, Real or Progressive Downloads

dimensions.name: Time
dimensions.description: Time as per time zone specified in the report

dimensions.name: Error Code
dimensions.description: Code representing the encountered error

dimensions.name: Service Provider
dimensions.description: CDN or delivery Service Provider used to stream the content.

dimensions.name: Stream Name
dimensions.description: Set automatically and indicates the Stream URL.

dimensions.name: Network
dimensions.description: Customer's service provider.

dimensions.name: Category
dimensions.description: Category of the content. For example: channel name, genre, content type (movies, tv shows, sports events, or other events).

dimensions.name: Player ID
dimensions.description: Name and version of player that played the media.

dimensions.name: Title/Event Name
dimensions.description: Name of the title/event

dimensions.name: Notification ID
dimensions.description: ID of the notification.

metrics.name: Diagnostic
metrics.description: Diagnostics

metrics.name: Alert Metrics
metrics.description: Metric values leading to a QoS notification. These help identify how the metrics relate to the thresholds set in notification rules.

name: Time Cube
description: Provides standard metrics for a time period at a granularity of one minute.

dimensions.name: Time
dimensions.description: Time as per time zone specified in the report

metrics.name: Errors
metrics.description: Total count of all errors

metrics.name: Availability
metrics.description: Average availability across all attempts (excluding user abandons). Calculated as the number of plays divided by plays+ startup errors.

metrics.name: Rebuffer Time per Play
metrics.description: Average time spent on rebuffering during each play.

metrics.name: Bandwidth
metrics.description: Average bandwidth experienced by users viewing the stream. The bitrate at which player buffer fills is sampled at intervals of 500 milliseconds. The sum average of these samples is represented as the average bandwidth.

metrics.name: Frames per Second
metrics.description: Number of frames rendered during each session of a playback. Frames per second values are sampled at intervals of 500 milliseconds during playback and their sum average is represented as the average frames per second.

metrics.name: Rebuffer Abandons
metrics.description: Sum of plays abandoned during a rebuffering event.

metrics.name: Start Up Time
metrics.description: Average startup time per session.

metrics.name: % Mid Play Errors
metrics.description: Percentage of errors experienced during the middle of play after a successful play start.

metrics.name: Rebuffers per Play
metrics.description: Average number of rebuffers experienced during a play.

metrics.name: Upshifts
metrics.description: Average number of times users experienced a bit rate upshift during a session.

metrics.name: Downshifts
metrics.description: Average number of times users experienced a bit rate downshift during a session.

metrics.name: Plays with Rebuffers
metrics.description: Sum of plays with at least one rebuffering event.

metrics.name: First Rebuffers
metrics.description: Number of first rebuffers encountered.

metrics.name: Plays Started
metrics.description: Attempts to playback content that result in successful playback.

metrics.name: Bitrate
metrics.description: Average bit rate at which stream is played back.

metrics.name: % Rebuffering Plays
metrics.description: Weighted average of rebuffering sessions calculated at a one-minute aggregation. You can plot this metric with content, ad, and geo dimensions to understand when rebuffering occurs most and the size of the audience it affects.

metrics.name: Dropped Frames
metrics.description: Average number of frames dropped per session during playback.

metrics.name: Start Up Errors
metrics.description: Number of startup errors.

metrics.name: Connect Time
metrics.description: Average time spent over initial connection to the server.

metrics.name: Buffer Time
metrics.description: Average time per session spent over initial buffering before the start of play.

metrics.name: Audience Size
metrics.description: Sum of concurrent streams or plays at a specific time. It can be used in all charts, except time, to show audience size for a chosen duration.

metrics.name: Attempts
metrics.description: Total number of attempts to play a stream.

metrics.name: % Rebuffering Plays(Avg)
metrics.description: Percentage of sessions that experienced rebuffers. The ratio of number of sessions rebuffering at least once to the total number of active sessions.

metrics.name: Rebuffer Time per Minute
metrics.description: Average amount of time spent rebuffering every minute of playback.

metrics.name: HD Play Duration
metrics.description: Time during which the stream played in HD quality (>=2.5 mpbs).

metrics.name: HQ Play Duration
metrics.description: Time during which the stream played in HQ quality (>=1.5 mpbs and <2.5 mbps).

metrics.name: SD Play Duration
metrics.description: Time during which the stream played in SD quality (<1.5 mpbs).

metrics.name: Aggregate Play Duration
metrics.description: Total number of hours that users played streams.

metrics.name: Play Duration per Play
metrics.description: Play duration divided by sum of plays.

metrics.name: Plays Ended
metrics.description: Plays ended include both completed and abandoned plays. You can plot this metric with the `Rebuffer Time per Minute` and `Rebuffers per Minute` dimensions.
